column4: Quick one: do US passport holders need a visa for Canada?
column5: I can search the web for current visa guidance and official sources. Want me to check?
column6: Available sources disagree on whether U.S. passport holders need a visa to enter Canada. While some sources state that American citizens do not need a Canadian visa for stays less than 180 days [1], others mention that holders of a foreign national passport, including U.S. citizens, may need a visa depending on their travel method and duration [3].

column1: NYC_June_Family_Trip
column5:
Based on web search results:
• US tourists typically do not need a visa for short Canadian stays
• Bring a valid passport; eTA applies to some nationalities (not US)
• Always verify on the official government site.

Sources: Brave Search

column6: Paragraph 1: U.S. citizens traveling to Japan enjoy a straightforward visa process. For stays under 90 days, no visa is required [1][3][6]. Japan operates on Japan Standard Time (JST), which is 13 hours ahead of Washington D.C. and does not observe daylight saving time [1][6].
